SENT.plain: We describe a 24-year old Caucasian man with gangrene of small bowels and intestinal resection due to mesenteric inflammatory veno-occlusive disease (MIVOD) who later developed deep vein thrombosis in his left leg
He had no clinical evidence of an underlying symptomatic connective tissue disease or BehÃ§et's disease
An IgG anticardiolipin antibody titre above 60 GPL unit/mL and thrombocytopenia confirmed the diagnosis of primary antiphospholipid syndrome (APS)
This is the first known case of APS associated with MIVOD
